entry.summary: In this survey paper we give an overview over constructions of geometries associated to Jordan structures (algebras, triple systems and pairs), featuring analogs of these constructions with the Lie functor on the one hand and with the approach of non-commutative geometry on the other hand.

entry.title: Additivity of Maps on Triangular Algebras
entry.summary: We prove that every multiplicative bijective map, Jordan bijective map, and Jordan triple bijective map from a triangular algebra onto any ring is automatically additive.

entry.title: Corings with exact rational functors and injective objects
entry.summary: We describe how some aspects of abstract localization on module categories have applications to the study of injective comodules over some special types of corings. We specialize the general results to the case of Doi-Koppinen modules, generalizing previous results in this setting.

entry.title: Automorphisms and derivations of free Poisson algebras in two variables
entry.summary: Let P be a free Poisson algebra in two variables over a field of characteristic zero. We prove that the automorphisms of P are tame and that the locally nilpotent derivations of P are triangulable.

entry.title: Somewhat stochastic matrices
entry.summary: The standard theorem for regular stochastic matrices is generalized to matrices with no sign restriction on the entries. The condition that column sums be equal to 1 is kept, but the regularity condition is replaced by a condition on the $\ell_1$-distances between columns.

entry.title: Enveloping algebras of Hom-Lie algebras
entry.summary: Enveloping algebras of Hom-Lie and Hom-Leibniz algebras are constructed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 16 pages. To appear in Journal of Generalized Lie Theory and Applications
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Journal of Generalized Lie Theory and Applications 2 (2008), 95-108.

entry.title: Albert algebras over curves of genus zero and one
entry.summary: Albert algebras and other Jordan algebras are constructed over curves of genus zero and one, using a generalization of the Tits process and the first Tits construction due to Achhammer.

entry.title: Noetherian Hopf algebras
entry.summary: This short survey article reviews current understand- ing of the structure of noetherian Hopf algebras. The focus is on homological properties. A number of open problems are listed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages;for conference at Antalya, Turkey in memory of Brian Hartley

entry.title: Rigidity in the intersection of varieties does not imply rigidity in the intersecting varieties
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to a crucial error in example.

entry.title: Notes on formal smoothness
entry.summary: The definition of an S-category is proposed by weakening the axioms of a Q-category introduced by Kontsevich and Rosenberg. Examples of Q- and S-categories and (co)smooth objects in such categories are given.

entry.title: Subalgebras of Lie algebras with non-degenerate restriction of the Killing form
entry.summary: Let $\mf{g}$ be any finite-dimensional Lie algebra with Killling form $B$. Let $\mf{h}$ be a subalgebra of $\mf{g}$ on which the Killing form is non degenerate. Then $\mf{h}$ is reductive.

entry.title: Coset decomposition for semisimple Hopf algebras
entry.summary: The notion of double coset for semisimple finite dimensional Hopf algebras is introduced. This is done by considering an equivalence relation on the set of irreducible characters of the dual Hopf algebra. As an application formulae for the restriction of the irreducible characters to normal Hopf subalgebras are given.

entry.title: Real forms and finite order automorphisms of affine Kac-Moody algebras - an outline of a new approach
entry.summary: We outline a new approach to classify real forms and automorphisms of finite order of affine Kac-Moody algebras.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages. To appear in RIMS Kokyuroku

entry.title: Symmetric units in integral group rings
entry.summary: In this paper, we study the question of when the symmetric units in an integral group ring ZG form a multiplicative group. When G is periodic, necessary and sufficient conditions are given for this to occur.

entry.title: Further results on the Craig-Sakamoto equation
entry.summary: In this paper necessary and sufficient conditions are stated for the Craig-Sakamoto equation det(I-sA-tB) = det(I-sA)det(I-tB), for all scalars s, t. Moreover, spectral properties for A and B are investigated.
entry.arxiv:comment: International Conference of Applied and Engineering Mathematics (ICAEM 2007), London

entry.title: 2-Cocycles of Deformative Schrödinger-Virasoro Algebras
entry.summary: In a series of papers by Henkel, Roger and Unterberger, Schr\"{o}dinger-Virasoro algebras and their deformations were introduced and investigated. In the present paper we determine the 2-cocycles of a class of deformative Schr\"{o}dinger-Virasoro algebras.

entry.title: Leibniz Central Extension on the Twisted Schrödinger-Virasoro Algebra
entry.summary: In this paper we present all the Leibniz 2-cocycles of the twisted Schr\"{o}dinger-Virasoro algebra, which determine its second Leibniz cohomology group.

entry.title: The conjugacy problem for two by two matrices over polynomial rings
entry.summary: We give an effective solution of the conjugacy problem for two by two matrices over the polynomial ring in one variable over a finite field.

entry.title: Quantizations of the $W$ Algebra W(2,2)
entry.summary: We quantize the $W$-algebra W(2,2), whose Verma modules, Harish-Chandra modules, irreducible weight modules and Lie bialgebra structures have been investigated and determined in a series of papers recently.

entry.title: On quasi-Frobenius semigroup algebras
entry.summary: We define quasi-Frobenius semigroups and find necessary and sufficient conditions under which a semigroup algebra of a 0-cancellative semigroup is quasi-Frobenius.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Lect. Notes Pure Appl. Math., 248, Chapman & Hall/CRC, Boca Raton, FL, 2006, 287-291

entry.title: A Note on Coseparable Coalgebras
entry.summary: Given a coalgebra $C$ over a commutative ring $R,$ we show that $C$ can be considered as a (not necessarily counital) $C^{\ast op}$-coring. Moreover, we show that this coring has a left (right) counity if and only if $C$ is coseparable as an $R$-coalgebra.

entry.title: Groebner-Shirshov Bases for Lie Algebras: after A. I. Shirshov
entry.summary: In this paper, we review Shirshov's method for free Lie algebras invented by him in 1962 which is now called the Groebner-Shirshov bases theory.

entry.title: Automorphisms of elliptic Poisson algebras
entry.summary: We describe the automorphism groups of elliptic Poisson algebras on polynomial algebras in three variables and give an explicit set of generators and defining relations for this group.

entry.title: On some criterions of finiteness conditions in commutative Moufang loops
entry.summary: The various finiteness conditions in commutative Moufang loops are characterized using the notions of centralizer of subloops and centralizer of subgroups of its multiplication group.

entry.title: Models of some simple modular Lie superalgebras
entry.summary: Models of the exceptional simple modular Lie superalgebras in characteristic $p\geq 3$, that have appeared in the classification due to Bouarroudj, Grozman and Leites of the Lie superalgebras with indecomposable symmetrizable Cartan matrices, are provided. The models relate these exceptional Lie superalgebras to some low dimensional nonassociative algebraic systems.

entry.title: Classification of complex naturally graded quasi-filiform Zinbiel algebras
entry.summary: In this work the description up to isomorphism of complex naturally graded quasi-filiform Zinbiel algebras is obtained.

entry.title: Quotients in supergeometry
entry.summary: The purpose of this paper is to present the notion of quotient of supergroups in different categories using the unified treatment of the functor of points and to examine some physically interesting examples.

entry.title: A note on the span of Hadamard products of vectors
entry.summary: We give a new proof of Theorem 6 in [L. Qiu and X. Zhan, On the span of Hadamard products of vectors, Linear Algebra Appl. 422 (2007) 304--307].

entry.title: The initial meadows
entry.summary: A \emph{meadow} is a commutative ring with an inverse operator satisfying $0^{-1}=0$. We determine the initial algebra of the meadows of characteristic 0 and show that its word problem is decidable.

entry.title: N-th root
entry.summary: The quaternion equation X^n=A is solved for any integer number n > 1. A is a given quaternion with komplex numbers as its elements. We use the isomorphism between quaternions and (4,4)-matrices to solve this equation.

entry.title: More non semigroup Lie gradings
entry.summary: This note is devoted to the construction of two very easy examples, of respective dimensions 4 and 6, of graded Lie algebras whose grading is not given by a semigroup, the latter one being a semisimple algebra. It is shown that 4 is the minimal possible dimension.

entry.title: Vector product algebras
entry.summary: Vector products can be defined on spaces of dimensions 0, 1, 3 and 7 only, and their isomorphism types are determined entirely by their adherent symmetric bilinear forms. We present a short and elementary proof for this classical result.

entry.title: Trace Forms of Symbol Algebras
entry.summary: Let S be a symbol algebra. The trace form of S is computed and it is shown how this form can be used to determine whether S is a division algebra or not. In addition, the exterior powers of the trace form of S are computed.

entry.title: The Depth of a Hypersubstitution
entry.summary: For given depth of a we derive a formula for the depth of the image of that term under a given hypersubstitution.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Journal of Automata, Languages and Combinatorics 6 (2001) 3, 253-262

entry.title: Strong group coalgebras
entry.summary: We introduce strong group coalgebras, as a generalization of strongly graded coalgebras. We give several characterizations, and study two special types of strong group coalgebras, namely cleft group algebras (or crossed coproduct group coalgebras) and smash coproduct group coalgebras.

entry.title: SK1 of Azumaya algebras over hensel pairs
entry.summary: Let A be an Azumaya algebra of constant rank n^2 over a Hensel pair (R,I) where R is a semilocal ring with n invertible in R. Then the reduced Whitehead group SK(A) coincides with its reduction SK(A/IA).

entry.title: Module Hom-algebras
entry.summary: We study a twisted version of module algebras called module Hom-algebras. It is shown that module algebras deform into module Hom-algebras via endomorphisms. As an example, we construct certain q-deformations of the usual sl(2)-action on the affine plane.

entry.title: Classification of modules of the intermediate series over the twisted N=2 superconformal algebra
entry.summary: In this paper, a classification of modules of the intermediate series over the twisted N=2 superconformal algebra is obtained.

entry.title: Lie superbialgebra structures on the centerless twisted N=2 superconformal algebra
entry.summary: In this paper, Lie superbialgebra structures on the centerless twisted N=2 superconformal algebra $\LL$ are considered which are proved to be coboundary triangular.

entry.title: On certain categories of modules for twisted affine Lie algebras
entry.summary: We classify integrable irreducible $\hat{g}[\sigma]$-modules in categories E and C, where E is proved to contain the well known evaluation modules and C to unify highest weight modules, evaluation modules and their tensor product modules.

entry.title: Combinatorics and N-Koszul algebras
entry.summary: The numerical Hilbert series combinatorics and the comodule Hilbert series combinatorics are introduced, and some applications are presented, including the MacMahon Master Theorem.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages; to appear in International Journal of Geometric Methods in Mathematical Physics; conference in honour of Michel Dubois-Violette

entry.title: Clifford theory for cocentral extensions
entry.summary: The classical Clifford correspondence for normal subgroups is considered in the more general setting of semisimple Hopf algebras. We prove that this correspondence still holds if the extension determined by the normal Hopf subalgebra is cocentral.

entry.title: Ideal Structure of Clifford Algebras
entry.summary: The structures of the ideals of Clifford algebras which can be both infinite dimensional and degenerate over the real numbers are investigated.
entry.arxiv:comment: The original publication is available at http://www.springerlink.com

entry.title: Novikov operad is not Koszul
entry.summary: An algebra with identities $a\circ(b\circ c-c\circ b)=(a\circ b)\circ c-(a\circ c)\circ b$ and $a\circ(b\circ c)=b\circ(a\circ c)$ is called Novikov. We show that Novikov operad is not Koszul.

entry.title: The operads of planar forests are Koszul
entry.summary: We describe the Koszul dual of two quadratic operads on planar forests introduced to study the infinitesimal Hopf algebra of planar rooted trees and prove that these operads are Koszul.

entry.title: The FGF-conjecture for pseudocompact algebras
entry.summary: The paper has been withdrawn due to a crucial error in section 3.

entry.title: Invertible unital bimodules over rings with local units, and related exact sequences of groups
entry.summary: Given an extension $R \subseteq S$ of rings with same set of local units, inspired by the works of Miyashita, we construct four exact sequences of groups relating Picard's groups of $R$ and $S$.

entry.title: A remark to "A note on the Fundamental Group of a Triangular Algebra", by F.Xu
entry.summary: We provide a counter-example to Proposition 3.2 of "A note on the Fundamental Group of a Triangular Algebra", by F.Xu.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages. This note will not be submitted for publication in any other journal

entry.title: A short proof of Grinshpon's theorem
entry.summary: Grinshpon has proved that if $S$ is a commutative subring of a ring $R$ and $A\in M_n(S)$ is invertible in $M_n(R)$, then $det(A)$ is invertible in $R$. We give a very short proof of the result.

entry.title: On simple modules for the restricted Lie superalgebra $gl(m|n)$
entry.summary: In this paper, we study the simple modules for the restricted Lie superalgebra $gl(m|n)$. A condition for the simplicity of the induced modules is given, and an analogue of Kac-Weisfeiler theorem is proved.

entry.title: Representations of the restricted Cartan type Lie superalgebra $W(m,n,1)$
entry.summary: Simple modules for the restricted Witt superalgebra $W(m,n,1)$ are considered. Conditions are provided for the restricted and nonrestricted Kac modules to be simple.

entry.title: The identities and the central polynomials of the infinite dimensional unitary Grassmann algebra over a finite field
entry.summary: We describe the T-ideal of identities and the T-space of central polynomials for the infinite dimensional unitary Grassmann algebra over a finite field.

entry.title: The identities and central polynomials of the finite dimensional unitary Grassmann algebras over a finite field
entry.summary: We describe the T-ideal of identities and the T-space of central polynomials for the unitary finite dimensional Grassmann algebra over a finite field.

entry.title: PI-groups and PI-representations of groups
entry.summary: It is well known that many famous Burnside-type problems have positive solutions for PI-groups and PI-algebras. In the present article we also consider various Burnside-type problems for PI-groups and PI-representations of groups.

entry.title: Subfields of nondegenerate tame semiramified division algebras
entry.summary: We show in this article that in many cases the subfields of a nondegenerate tame semiramified division algebra of prime power degree over a Henselian valued field are inertial field extensions of the center.

entry.title: Unitary Units of The Group Algebra ${\mathbb{F}}_{2^k}Q_{8}$
entry.summary: The structure of the unitary unit group of the group algebra ${\F}_{2^k} Q_{8}$ is described as a Hamiltonian group.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: International Journal of Algebra and Computation, Vol. 19, No. 2 (2009) 283-286

entry.title: Division Algebras and Wireless Communication
entry.summary: We survey the recent use of division algebras in wireless communication.
entry.arxiv:comment: Survey paper, 12 pages; minor edits in second version

entry.title: Gradings on simple algebras of finitary matrices
entry.summary: We describe gradings by finite abelian groups on the associative algebras of infinite matrices with finitely many nonzero entries, over an algebraically closed field of characteristic zero.

entry.title: Derived Equivalences Between Associative Deformations
entry.summary: We prove that if two associative deformations (parameterized by the same complete local ring) are derived Morita equivalent, then they are Morita equivalent (in the classical sense).

entry.title: Prime Filters in an MV-algebra
entry.summary: In this document we consider the prime spectrum of an MV-algebra with certain natural operations. These are used to show connections between the classes of prime lattice filters and prime implication filters.

entry.title: Prime Filters in MV-algebras II
entry.summary: In this document we consider the prime and maximal spectra of an MV-algebra with certain natural operations. Several new MV-algebras are constructed in this fashion.

entry.title: An upper bound on the essential dimension of a central simple algebra
entry.summary: We prove a new upper bound on the essential p-dimension of the projective linear group PGLn.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: J. Algebra, 329, no. 1 (Special Issue Celebrating the 60th Birthday of Corrado De Concini), 213-221 (2011)

entry.title: The local functors of points of Supermanifolds
entry.summary: We study the local functor of points (which we call the Weil-Berezin functor) for smooth supermanifolds, providing a characterization, representability theorems and applications to differential calculus.

entry.title: On similar matrices over the dual numbers
entry.summary: Matrices over the dual numbers are considered. We propose an approach to classify these matrices up to similarity. Some preliminary results on the realization of this approach are obtained. In particular, we produce explicitly canonical matrices of orders 2 and 3.

entry.title: On division algebras having the same maximal subfields
entry.summary: We address the problem of when two finite dimensional central division algebras over the same field are necessarily isomorphic given that they have the same maximal subfields.

entry.title: On simple ringoids
entry.summary: A ringoid is a set with two binary operations that are linked by the distributive laws. We study special classes of ringoids that are congruence-simple or ideal-simple. In particular, we examine generalised parasemifields and non-associative semirings.

entry.title: Characterization of preclones by matrix collections
entry.summary: Preclones are described as the closed classes of the Galois connection induced by a preservation relation between operations and matrix collections. The Galois closed classes of matrix collections are also described by explicit closure conditions.

entry.title: Maximal graded subalgebras of Witt and Special superalgebras
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to that the main results and approaches are closedly parallel to the ones in Lie algebra case.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors

entry.title: A dichotomy result for prime algebras of Gelfand-Kirillov dimension two
entry.summary: Let $k$ be an uncountable field. We show that a finitely generated prime Goldie $k$-algebra of quadratic growth is either primitive or satisfies a polynomial identity, answering a question of Small in the affirmative.

entry.title: Filtered multiplicative bases of restricted enveloping algebras
entry.summary: We study the problem of the existence of filtered multiplicative bases of a restricted enveloping algebra u(L), where L is a finite-dimensional and p-nilpotent restricted Lie algebra over a field of positive characteristic p.

entry.title: Self-commuting lattice polynomial functions
entry.summary: We provide sufficient conditions for a lattice polynomial function to be self-commuting. We explicitly describe self-commuting polynomial functions over chains.

entry.title: On the centralizers in the Weyl algebra
entry.summary: Let P,Q be elements of the Weyl algebra W. We prove that if [Q,P]=1, then the centralizer of P is the polynomial algebra k[P].

entry.title: Identities of dual Leibniz algebras
entry.summary: We prove that in characteristic 0 any proper subvariety of the variety of dual Leibniz algebras is nilpotent. Consequently, the variety of dual Leibniz algebras is Shpekhtian and has base rank 1.

entry.title: F-schemes
entry.summary: In this paper, the notion of F-schemes, a "generalization" of schemes, is introduced to cover unitary noncommutative rings.
entry.arxiv:comment: This is a more complete version than the previous one (with some changes in notations)

entry.title: Tropical mathematics, classical mechanics and geometry
entry.summary: A very brief introduction to tropical and idempotent mathematics is presented. Applications to classical mechanics and geometry are especially examined.

entry.title: Notes on formal deformations of abelian categories
entry.summary: In these notes we provide the foundation for the deformation theoretic parts of arXiv:0807.3753 and arXiv:math/0102005.
entry.arxiv:comment: 20 pages; some proofs and typos corrected

entry.title: Basic solutions of systems with two max-linear inequalities
entry.summary: We give an explicit description of the basic solutions of max-linear systems with two inequalities.

entry.title: Gradings by Groups on Graded Cartan Type Lie Algebras
entry.summary: In this paper we describe all gradings by abelian groups without elements of order p, where p > 2 is the characteristic of the base field, on the simple graded Cartan type Lie algebras.

entry.title: An alternative approach to the structure theory of PI-rings
entry.summary: We expose a rather simple and direct approach to the structure theory of prime PI-rings ("Posner's theorem"), based on fundamental properties of the extended centroid of a prime ring.

entry.title: On Drinfel'd twist deformation of the super-Virasoro algebra
entry.summary: In this paper, we describe nonstandard quantum deformation of the super-Virasoro algebra. Using the Drinfel'd twist quantization technique, we obtain the deformed coproduct and antipode. Hence we get a family of noncommutative and noncocommutative Hopf superalgebras.

entry.title: (Finite) presentations of Bi-Zassenhaus loop algebras
entry.summary: We prove that Bi-Zassenhaus loop algebras are finitely presented up to central and second central elements. In particular, we show an explicit finite presentation for a Lie algebra whose quotient over its second centre is isomorphic to a Bi-Zassenhaus loop algebra.

entry.title: Hopf-Galois extensions and isomorphisms of small categories
entry.summary: We associate two linear categories with two objects to a module over the subalgebra of coinvariants of a Hopf-Galois extension, and prove that they are isomorphic. The structure Theorem for cleft extensions, and the Militaru \cStefan lifting Theorem can be obtained using these isomorphisms.

entry.title: Total positivity and cluster algebras
entry.summary: This is a brief and informal introduction to cluster algebras. It roughly follows the historical path of their discovery, made jointly with A.Zelevinsky. Total positivity serves as the main motivation.
entry.arxiv:comment: Notes for a talk at ICM 2010

entry.title: Rings whose proper factors are right perfect
entry.summary: We show that practically all the properties of almost perfect rings discovered by Bazzoni and Salce in "Almost perfect domains" (Colloq. Math. 95 (2) (2003), 285-301) for commutative rings hold in the non-commutative setting.

entry.title: Derivations and automorphisms of twisted deformative Schrödinger-Virasoro Lie algebras
entry.summary: In this paper the derivation algebra and automorphism group of the twisted deformative Schr\"{o}dinger-Virasoro Lie algebras are determined.

entry.title: A Universal Approach to Vertex Algebras
entry.summary: We characterize vertex algebras (in a suitable sense) as algebras over a certain graded co-operad. We also discuss some examples and categorical implications of this characterization.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in the Journal of Algebra

entry.title: Simple algebra with arbitrary odd Gelfand-Kirillov dimension
entry.summary: It is given an example of finitely generated simple algebra over a field k (char k = 0) with arbitrary odd Gel'fand-Kirillov dimension.

entry.title: The Representation Dimension of a Class of Tame Algebras
entry.summary: We prove that, if A is a strongly simply connected algebra of polynomial growth, then A is torsionless-finite. In particular, its representation dimension is at most three.

entry.title: Embeddings into the countable atomless Boolean algebra
entry.summary: We prove that there is a lattice embedded from every countable distributive lattice into the Boolean algebra of computable subsets of $\mathbb{N}$. Along the way, we discuss all relevant results about lattices, Boolean algebras and embeddings between them.

entry.title: Subtraction Menger algebras
entry.summary: Abstract characterizations of Menger algebras of partial $n$-place functions defined on a set $A$ and closed under the set-theoretic difference functions treatment as subsets of the Cartesian product $A^{n+1}$ are given.

entry.title: Ordered forests and parking functions
entry.summary: We prove that the Hopf algebra of parking functions and the Hopf algebra of ordered forests are isomorphic, using a rigidity theorem for a particular type of bialgebras.

entry.title: On simple Filippov superalgebras of type A(0,n)
entry.summary: It is proved that there exist no simple finite-dimensional Filippov superalgebras of type A(0,n) over an algebraically closed field of characteristic 0.

entry.title: On simple Filippov superalgebras of type A(m,n)
entry.summary: It is proved that there exist no simple finite-dimensional Filippov superalgebras of type A(m,n) over an algebraically closed field of characteristic 0.

entry.title: Nil algebras with restricted growth
entry.summary: It is shown that over an arbitrary countable field, there exists a finitely generated algebra that is nil, infinite dimensional, and has Gelfand-Kirillov dimension at most three.

entry.title: Mutating Brauer trees
entry.summary: In this paper we introduce mutation of Brauer trees. We show that our mutation of Brauer trees explicitly describes the tilting mutation of Brauer tree algebras introduced by Okuyama and Rickard.

entry.title: A Localization in MV-algebras
entry.summary: In this document we consider a way of localizing an MV-algebra. Given any prime filter $F$ we find a local MV-algebra which has the same poset of prime filters as the poset of prime filters comparable to $F$.

entry.title: Determination of division algebras with 243 elements
entry.summary: Finite nonassociative division algebras (i.e., finite semifields) with 243 elements are completely classified.

entry.title: $δ$-derivations of classical Lie superalgebras
entry.summary: We consider the $\delta$-derivations of classical Lie superalgebras and prove that these superalgebras admit nonzero $\delta$-derivations only when $\delta = 0,1/2,1$. The structure of $1/2$-derivations for classical Lie superalgebras is completely determined.

entry.title: Degree estimate for subalgebras
entry.summary: Based on Bergman's Lemma on centralizers, we obtain a sharp lower degree bound for nonconstant elements in a subalgebra generated by two elements of a free associative algebra over an arbitrary field.

entry.title: Using Hook Schur Functions to Compute Matrix Cocharacters
entry.summary: We use hook Schur functions to compute trace cocharacters of matrices in hooks. As an example we compute the cocharacters of 3 x 3 matrices in the one by two hook.

entry.title: Hurwitz' theorem on composition algebras
entry.summary: The main aim of this article is to give an exposition of the diagrammatic proof due to Boos and Rost of the theorem of Hurwitz that the dimension of a composition algebra is one of 0,1,2,4,8.

entry.title: On Engel's Theorem for Leibniz algebras
entry.summary: I give a simpler proof of the generalisation of Engel's Theorem to Leibniz algebras.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages. Proof of cited theorem of Loday and Pirashvili added

entry.title: Bases for partially commutative Lie algebras
entry.summary: In this paper, linear bases for the partially commutative Lie algebras are found. The method of the Gr\"{o}bner--Shirshov bases is used. It easily follows from the structure that the equality problem is algorithmically solvable for the partially commutative Lie algebras.

entry.title: About a moduli space of elliptic curves and the Golay code G_{24}
Riemann Surfaces and Vertex Operator Algebras
entry.summary: We show that for any fixed point P on a Riemann surface S the distinct realizations of cocycles in H^1(S,O) correspond to the natural appearence of the standard Heisenberg vertex operator algebra II(P) and to the commutative Heisenberg vertex operator algebra II*(P) respectively

entry.title: Hopf-like Algebras and Extended P-B-W Theorems
entry.summary: Based on invariant algebras, we introduce representations$^{6-th}$ of Lie algebras and representations$^{< 4-th>}$ of Leibniz algebras, give the extended P-B-W Theorems in the context of the new representations of Lie algebras and Leibniz algebras, and generalize the Hopf-algebra structure on the enveloping algebras of Lie Algebras.

entry.title: Torsion units in integral group rings of Conway simple groups
entry.summary: Using the Luthar--Passi method, we investigate the possible orders and partial augmentations of torsion units of the normalized unit group of integral group rings of Conway simple groups $Co_1$, $Co_2$ and $Co_3$.

entry.title: Lower bounds of Growth of Hopf algebras
entry.summary: Some lower bounds of GK-dimension of Hopf algebras are given.

entry.title: Jacobson's Refinement of Engel's Theorem for Leibniz Algebras
entry.summary: We develop Jacobson's refinement of Engel's Theorem for Leibniz algebras. We then note some consequences of the result.

entry.title: Fine gradings on exceptional simple Lie superalgebras
entry.summary: The fine abelian group gradings on the simple exceptional classical Lie superalgebras over algebraically closed fields of characteristic 0 are determined up to equivalence.

entry.title: Simple Moufang loops and alternative algebras
entry.summary: Let a Moufang loop Q contain a non-unitary subloop, which is a simple loop. Then Q is not embedded into a loop of invertible elements of any alternative algebra.

entry.title: Minimal clones with weakly abelian representations
entry.summary: We show that a minimal clone has a nontrivial weakly abelian representation iff it has a nontrivial abelian representation, and that in this case all representations are weakly abelian.

entry.title: Associative spectra of binary operations
entry.summary: The distance of a binary operation from being associative can be "measured" by its associative spectrum, an appropriate sequence of positive integers. Particular instances and general properties of associative spectra are studied.

entry.title: Simple archimedean dimension groups
entry.summary: We answer a question of Goodearl, by constructing for every metrizable Choquet simplex, a dimension group that is simple and archimedean and whose trace space is the desired Choquet simplex.

entry.title: Lattices of subalgebras of Leibniz algebras
entry.summary: I describe the lattice of subalgebras of a one-generator Leibniz algebra. Using this, I show that, apart from one special case, a lattice isomorphism between Leibniz algebras L, L' maps the Leibniz kernel of L to that of L'.

entry.title: Quotients of Koszul algebras with almost linear resolution
entry.summary: We compute the Hilbert series, and the graded vector space structure, of Ext-algebras of quotients of Koszul algebras with almost linear resolution. The example of the generic determinantal varieties is treated in detail.

entry.title: Hom-algebras via PROPs
entry.summary: Hom-algebras over a PROP are defined and studied. Several twisting constructions for Hom-algebras over a large class of PROPs are proved, generalizing many such results in the literature. Partial classification of Hom-algebras over a PROP is obtained.

entry.title: Universal central extensions of direct limits of Lie superalgebras
entry.summary: We show that the universal central extension of a direct limit of perfect Lie superalgebras L_i is (isomorphic to) the direct limit of the universal central extensions of L_i. As an application we describe the universal central extensions of some infinite rank Lie superalgebras.

entry.title: Finitely generated, non-artinian monolithic modules
entry.summary: We survey noetherian rings $A$ over which the injective hull of every simple module is locally artinian. Then we give a general construction for algebras $A$ that do not have this property. In characteristic 0, we also complete the classification of down-up algebras with this property.

entry.title: Morita equivalence of inverse semigroups
entry.summary: We describe how to construct all inverse semigroups Morita equivalent to a given inverse semigroup. This is done by taking the maximum inverse images of the regular Rees matrix semigroups over the inverse semigroup where the sandwich matrix satisfies what we call the McAlister conditions.

entry.title: C*-Rhapsody
entry.summary: In the paper I considered linear and antilinear mappings of finite dimensional algebra over complex field, as well I considered involution. I considered also an example of $C^*$\Hyph algebra.
entry.arxiv:comment: English text - 28 pages; Russian text - 30 pages

entry.title: Hopf algebras of GK-dimension two with vanishing Ext-group
entry.summary: We construct and study a family of finitely generated Hopf algebra domains $H$ of Gelfand-Kirillov dimension two such that $\Ext^1_H(k,k)=0$. Consequently, we answer a question of Goodearl and the second-named author.

entry.title: Modules over quantum Laurent polynomials I
entry.summary: It is shown that the Gelfand--Kirillov dimension for modules over quantum Laurent polynomials is tensor-minimal. The Brookes--Groves invariant associated with a tensor product of modules is determined. It is also shown that there can be nonholonmic simple modules.

entry.title: Abelian gradings in Lie algebras
entry.summary: Given a Lie algebra $L$ graded by a group $G$, if $L$ is does not contain orthogonal graded ideals and $G$ is generated by the support of $L$, then $G$ is an abelian group.

entry.title: Algebra with Conjugation
entry.summary: In the paper, I consider properties and mappings of free algebra with unit. I consider also conjugation of free algebra with unit.
entry.arxiv:comment: English text - 11 pages; Russian text - 11 pages
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Clifford Analysis, Clifford Algebras and their applications, Vol. 3, No. 1, pages 195 - 203, 2012

entry.title: A kind of infinite-dimensional Novikov algebras and its realization
entry.summary: In this paper, we construct a kind of infinite-dimensional Novikov algebras and give its realization by hyperbolic sine functions and hyperbolic cosine functions.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Abstract and Applied Analysis,2013, Article ID 270937, 5 pages

entry.title: Automorphisms of the two-parameter Hopf algebra $\V$
entry.summary: We determine the group of algebra automorphisms for the two-parameter quantized enveloping algebra $\V$. As an application, we prove that the group of Hopf algebra automorphisms for $\V$ is isomorphic to a torus of rank two.

entry.title: $δ$-superderivations of semisimple Jordan superalgebras
entry.summary: We described $\delta$-derivations and $\delta$-superderivations of simple and semisimple finite-dimensional Jordan superalgebras over algebraic closed fields with characteristic $p\neq2$. We constructed new examples of 1/2-derivations and 1/2-superderivations of simple Zelmanov's superalgebra $V_{1/2}(Z,D).$

entry.title: Atomic bases in cluster algebras of types A and $\widetilde A$
entry.summary: We give explicit atomic bases of arbitrary coefficient-free cluster algebras of types $A$ and $\widetilde A$.

entry.title: Automorphic Equivalence of Linear Algebras
entry.summary: In the variety of all linear algebras over the infinite field the difference between geometric and automorphic equivalence of algebras can be big.

entry.title: Octonion multiplication and Heawood's map
entry.summary: In this note, the octonion multiplication table is recovered from a regular tesselation of the "equilateral" two dimensional torus by seven hexagons, also known as Heawood's map.

entry.title: A Cayley-Hamilton trace identity for 2 x 2 matrices over Lie-solvable rings
entry.summary: We exhibit a Cayley-Hamilton trace identity for $2\times2$ matrices with entries in a ring $R$ satisfying $[[x,y],[x,z]]=0$ and 1/2 \in R$.

entry.title: Cayley-Dickson and Clifford Algebras as Twisted Group Algebras
entry.summary: The effect of some properties of twisted groups on the associated algebras, particularly Cayley-Dickson and Clifford algebras. It is conjectured that the Hilbert space of square-summable sequences is a Cayley-Dickson algebra.

entry.title: On extensions of Lie algebras
entry.summary: In the note some construction of Lie algebras is introduced. It is proved that the construction has the same property as a well known wreath product of groups [1]: Any extension of groups can be embedded into their wreath product [2].

entry.title: Free group algebras in Malcev-Neumann skew fields of fractions
entry.summary: Let K be a skew field and (G,<) an ordered group. We show that the skew field generated by the group ring K[G] inside the Malcev-Neumann series ring K((G;<)) contains noncommutative free group algebras.

entry.title: Bisimple monogenic orthodox semigroups
entry.summary: We give a complete description of the structure of all bisimple orthodox semigroups generated by two mutually inverse elements.

entry.title: Singular equivalences induced by homological epimorphisms
entry.summary: We prove that a certain homological epimorphism between two algebras induces a triangle equivalence between their singularity categories. Applying the result to a construction of matrix algebras, we describe the singularity categories of some non-Gorenstein algebras.

entry.title: Dichotomy of the addition of natural numbers
entry.summary: This is an elementary presentation of the arithmetic of trees. We show how it is related to the Tamari poset. In the last part we investigate various ways of realizing this poset as a polytope (associahedron), including one inferred from Tamari's thesis.

entry.title: The Hadamard circulant conjecture
entry.summary: It is shown that if $H$ is a circulant Hadamard $4n\ti 4n $ then $n=1$. This proves the Hadamard circulant conjecture.
entry.arxiv:comment: This is post publication revision of on-line Bull. London Math. Soc. version which changes subsection 3.3

entry.title: On Levi's Theorem for Leibniz algebras
entry.summary: A Lie algebra over a field of characteristic 0 splits over its soluble radical and all complements are conjugate. I show that the splitting theorem extends to Leibniz algebras but that the conjugacy theorem does not.

entry.title: Generalized $d$-Koszul modules
entry.summary: Generalized \dK modules are introduced to solve an open problem: the odd Ext-module $\Eod(M)$ of a \dK module $M$ over a $d$-Koszul algebra $\m$ is a \K module over the even Yoneda algebra $\Eev(\m)$.

entry.title: Noncommutative identities
entry.summary: This is a slightly edited version of my talk on Mathematische Arbeitstagung 2011, Bonn. I present a result relating noncommutative Laurent polynomials with algebraic functions, and show examples of integrability and Laurent phenomenon for free noncommutative variables.

entry.title: On an example of δ-Koszul algebras
entry.summary: The main purpose of this paper is to study a concrete example of $\delta$-Koszul algebras, which is related to three questions raised by Green and Marcos in [3].

entry.title: Generalized Auslander-Reiten conjecture and derived equivalences
entry.summary: In this note, we prove that the generalized Auslander-Reiten conjecture is preserved under derived equivalences between Artin algebras.
entry.arxiv:comment: Submitted. arXiv admin note: text overlap with arXiv:1009.3794v4

entry.title: Elementary proof of Jordan-Kronecker theorem
entry.summary: In this paper we prove the Jordan-Kronecker theorem which gives a canonical form for a pair of skew-symmetric bilinear forms on a finite-dimensional vector space over an algebraically closed field.

entry.title: (n+1)-Ary derivations os semisimple Filippov algebras
entry.summary: We defined (n+1)-ary derivations of $n$-ary algebras. We described (n+1)-derivations of simple and semisimple finite-dimensional Filippov algebras over algebraically closed field zero characteristic. We constructed new examples of non-trivial (n+1)-ary derivations of Filippov algebras.

entry.title: On Conjugacy of Maximal Subalgebras of Solvable Lie Algebras
entry.summary: The purpose of this paper is to consider when two maximal subalgebras of a finite-dimensional solvable Lie algebra $L$ are conjugate, and to investigate their intersection.

entry.title: Fiedler-Ptak scaling in max algebra
entry.summary: This is essentially the text of my talk on Fiedler-Ptak scaling in max algebra delivered in the invited minisymposium in honor of Miroslav Fiedler at the 17th ILAS Conference in Braunschweig, Germany.

entry.title: Multidegree for bifiltered $D$-modules and hypergeometric systems
entry.summary: In that paper, we recall the notion of the multidegree for $D$-modules, as exposed in a previous paper, with a slight simplification. A particular emphasis is given on hypergeometric systems, used to provide interesting and computable examples.

entry.title: Presentations of Grothendieck constructions
entry.summary: We will give quiver presentations of the Grothendieck constructions of functors from a small category to the 2-category of $\Bbbk$-categories for a commutative ring $\Bbbk$.

entry.title: A Generalized Next-Closure Algorithm -- Enumerating Semilattice Elements from a Generating Set
entry.summary: We present a generalization of the well known Next-Closure algorithm working on semilattices. We prove the correctness of the algorithm and apply it on the computation of the intents of a formal context.

entry.title: Essential dimension of projective orthogonal and symplectic groups of small degree
entry.summary: In this paper, we study the essential dimension of classes of central simple algebras with involutions of index less or equal to 4. Using structural theorems for simple algebras with involutions, we obtain the essential dimension of projective and symplectic groups of small degree.

entry.title: Uniformly Flat Semimodules
entry.summary: We revisit the notion of flatness for semimodules over semirings. In particular, we introduce and study a new notion of uniformly flat semimodules based on the exactness of the tensor functor. We also investigate the relations between this notion and other notions of flatness for semimodules in the literature.

entry.title: Some identities in algebras obtained by the Cayley-Dickson process
entry.summary: In this paper we will prove that the Hall identity is true in all algebras obtained by the Cayley-Dickson process and, in some conditions, the converse is also true.

entry.title: Leavitt path algebras as partial skew group rings
entry.summary: We realize Leavitt path algebras as partial skew group rings and give new proofs, based on partial skew group ring theory, of the Cuntz-Krieger uniqueness theorem and simplicity criteria for Leavitt path algebras.

entry.title: Nonlinear Jordan Derivations of Triangular Algebras
entry.summary: In this paper we prove that any nonlinear Jordan derivation on triangular algebras is an additive derivation. As a byproduct, we obtain that any nonlinear Jordan derivation on nest algebras over infinite dimensional Hilbert spaces is inner.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, has been submitted for publication

entry.title: Decomposition of the Symmetric Powers
entry.summary: A decomposition of any symmetric power of $\Bbb C^2\otimes\Bbb C^2\otimes\Bbb C^2$ into irreducible $sl_2(\Bbb C)\oplus sl_2(\Bbb C)\oplus sl_2(\Bbb C)$-submodules are presented. Namely, the multiplicities of irreducible summands in the symmetric power are determined.

entry.title: Jordan Derivations and Lie derivations on Path Algebras
entry.summary: Without the faithful assumption, we prove that every Jordan derivation on a class of path algebras of quivers without oriented cycles is a derivation and that every Lie derivation on such kinds of algebras is of the standard form.

entry.title: Extensions of superalgebras of Krichever-Novikov type
entry.summary: An explicit construction of central extensions of Lie superalgebras of Krichever-Novikov type is given. In the case of Jordan superalgebras related to the superalgebras of Krichever-Novikov type we calculate a 1-cocycle with coefficients in the dual space.

entry.title: Some Graded Identities of The Cayley-Dickson Algebra
entry.summary: We work to find a basis of graded identities for the octonion algebra. We do so for the $\mathbb{Z}_2^2$ and $\mathbb{Z}_2^3$ gradings, both of them derived of the Cayley-Dickson process, the later grading being possible only when the characteristic of the scalars is not two.

entry.title: Positivity for cluster algebras of rank 3
entry.summary: We prove the positivity conjecture for skew-symmetric coefficient-free cluster algebras of rank 3.
entry.arxiv:comment: v2:Dedication inserted. To appear in Publ. Res. Inst. Math. Sci

entry.title: Symmetric Matrices over F_2 and the Lights Out Problem
entry.summary: We prove that the range of a symmetric matrix over F_2 contains the vector of its diagonal elements. We apply the theorem to a generalization of the "Lights Out" problem on graphs.

entry.title: A theorem of complete reducibility for exponential polynomials
entry.summary: In this paper we give a factorization theorem for the ring of exponential polynomials in many variables over an algebraically closed field of characteristic 0 with an exponentiation. This is a generalization of the factorization theorem due to Ritt in \cite{ritt}.

entry.title: Categories of layered semirings
entry.summary: We generalize the constructions of [17,19] to layered semirings, in order to enrich the structure and provide finite examples for applications in arithmetic (including finite examples). The layered category theory of [19] is extended accordingly, to cover noncancellative monoids.

entry.title: Representations$^{6-th}$ of Lie Algebras
entry.summary: We introduce representations$^{6-th}$ of Lie algebras, and study the counterparts of the P-B-W Theorem and the Hopf algebra structure for the enveloping algebras of Lie algebras in the context of representations$^{6-th}$ of Lie algebras.
entry.arxiv:comment: arXiv admin note: text overlap with arXiv:1012.2844

entry.title: On Generalized Fibonacci Quaternions and Fibonacci-Narayana Quaternions
entry.summary: In this paper, we investigate some properties of generalized Fibonacci quaternions and Fibonacci-Narayana quaternions.
entry.arxiv:comment: Accepted in Adv. in Appl. Clifford Algebras

entry.title: The center of a Kumjian-Pask algebra
entry.summary: The Kumjian-Pask algebras are path algebras associated to higher-rank graphs, and generalize the Leavitt path algebras. We study the center of simple Kumjian-Pask algebras and characterize commutative Kumjian-Pask algebras.

entry.title: Four dimensional Jordan algebras
entry.summary: In this paper, we classify four-dimensional Jordan algebras over an algebraically closed field of characteristic different of two. We establish the list of 73 non-isomorphic Jordan algebras.

entry.title: Spectrum nonincreasing maps on matrices
entry.summary: Maps $\Phi$ which do not increase the spectrum on complex matrices in a sense that $\Sp(\Phi(A)-\Phi(B))\subseteq\Sp(A-B)$ are classified.

entry.title: Non-degenerate Symmetric Invariant Bilinear Forms on the Deformative Schrödinger-Virasoro Algebras
entry.summary: In the present paper we shall determine all the non-degenerate symmetric invariant bilinear forms on the deformative Schr\"odinger-Virasoro algebras.

entry.title: Octonion algebras over rings are not determined by their norms
entry.summary: Answering a question of H. Petersson, we provide a class of examples of pair of octonion algebras over a ring having isometric norms.

entry.title: On Generalised Inflations of Right Modular Groupoids
entry.summary: We prove that if a right modular groupoid U is cancellative or has a left identity then a right modular generalised inflation of U is an inflation of U.

entry.title: Alternative algebras admitting derivations with invertible values and invertible derivations
entry.summary: We descibed all alternative algebras with invertible derivations (the analogue of Bergen-Herstein-Lanski's Theorem) and proved the analogue of Moens's Theorem.

entry.title: Characterizations of left orders in left Artinian rings
entry.summary: Small (1966), Robson (1967), Tachikawa (1971) and Hajarnavis (1972) have given different criteria for a ring to have a left Artinian left quotient ring. In this paper, three more new criteria are given.

entry.title: Semilattices of rectangular bands and groups of order two
entry.summary: We prove that a semigroup S is a semilattice of rectangular bands and groups of order two if and only if it satisfies the identity x = xxx and for all x,y in S, xyx is in the set {xyyx,yyxxy}.

entry.title: A Note on a Conjecture about Commuting Graphs
entry.summary: We prove that the diameter of the commuting graph of the full ma- trix ring over the real numbers is at most five. This answers, in the affir- mative, a conjecture proposed by Akbari-Mohammadian-radjavi-Raja, for the special case of the field of real numbers.

entry.title: Second Cohomology of q-deformed Witt superalgebras
entry.summary: The purpose of this paper is to compute the second adjoint cohomology group of q-deformed Witt superalgebras. They are Hom-Lie superalgebras obtained by q-deformation of Witt Lie superalgebra, that is one considers $\sigma$-derivations instead of classical derivations.

entry.title: Super Morita Theory
entry.summary: We develop the basics of Morita theory for super rings. As an application, we produce a more explicit super Morita equivalence in the case of super Azumaya algebras.

entry.title: The classification of algebras of level one
entry.summary: In the present paper we obtain the list of algebras, up to isomorphism, such that closure of any complex finite-dimensional algebra contains one of the algebra of the given list.

entry.title: Isotopic algebras with non-isomorphic congruence lattices
entry.summary: We give examples of pairs of isotopic algebras with non-isomorphic congruence lattices. This answers the question of whether all isotopic algebras have isomorphic congruence lattices.

entry.title: On minimal non-elementary Lie algebras
entry.summary: The class of minimal non-elementary Lie algebras over a field F are studied. These are classified when F is algebraically closed and of characteristic different from 2,3. The solvable algebras in this class are also characterised over any perfect field.

entry.title: Dependence spaces II
entry.summary: We introduce the concept of Exchange of Independent Sets (EIS) property for spaces. We show that in a dependence spaces the EIS property holds.

entry.title: Noncommutative Complete Intersections
entry.summary: Several generalizations of a commutative ring that is a graded complete intersection are proposed for a noncommutative graded $k$-algebra; these notions are justified by examples from noncommutative invariant theory.
